intro: Maripa repens, commonly known as the creeping maripa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
